metadata.titel_preek: Loving the Dreadful Day of Judgment

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from a culture of impunity and darkness to the restoration of all things through the judgment of God, where the church stands as a witness to this coming light.

tekstueel_bewijs: He will come again to set all things right.
God has not destined us for wrath, but to obtain salvation.
The power of the Ruler of the universe will be your strength.
The world will be purged of its iniquity.
To obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ.

zender.identificatie: The Triune God (Source of Holiness and Truth)
tekstueel_bewijs: The One who is and who was and who is to come, the Almighty.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Victims of Injustice and the Household of God
tekstueel_bewijs: Brothers and sisters of Christ by adoption
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Receiver (The hearer is placed 'first in line' for judgment but as a beneficiary of salvation)

tekstueel_bewijs: Christ Jesus himself being the cornerstone.
Through our Lord Jesus Christ, who died for us.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power (implied in the 'weapons of warfare')

tekstueel_bewijs: The darkness that comes on so abruptly.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but systemic, political, and spiritual evil that renders human beings 'bestial'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the church: keeping awake and performing deeds of kindness as signs of the Advent.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church/Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Deeds of kindness, justice, and repentance
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical action is a 'sign' of the primary action (God's coming). It follows the security found in the Cornerstone.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has not destined us for wrath.
He will come again to set all things right.
You [O Lord] have hidden your face from us.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We need to condemn the fascist period.
Let us keep awake and be sober.
We take up the weapons of his warfare.

voorbeelden: The time has come for judgment to begin.
We must live this perilous existence.
How shall we love the dreadful day of judgment?
Do we want a world without the wrath of God?
When we reflect upon that gospel truth.
The power of the Ruler of the universe will be your strength.
Nothing... can destroy a structure built upon the cornerstone.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God to judge and save, which then grants the 'Pouvoir' to the believer to stand and act.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (denial of judgment) to S2 (the horror of impunity), then to S1 (God's necessary judgment), and finally resolves in the tension of S1/Grace.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Judgment is redefined not as the opposite of love, but as the necessary act of love to end impunity.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; impunity is described as 'nothing less than hell'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon is 'dreadful' in its imagery, it is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor who ends the 'culture of impunity'. Human action is framed as a 'sign' of God's action, not the cause of it.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Any deed of kindness... is a sign of the advent.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The fellowship of the baptized has already passed through the judgment.
The tyrant Mugabe... Stalin's Gulag... the darkness.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon uses contemporary victims and historical villains not as models to imitate, but as evidence for the necessity of a Divine Judge.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Security amidst cosmic foreboding; relief that evil is judged.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification is an objective reality ('already passed through') that enables ethical sobriety.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'darkness' of the world to the 'security' of the cornerstone is logically and narratively seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God's wrath' and 'God's love' as two faces of the same thing.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The power of the Ruler of the universe will be your strength... He will come again to set all things right.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes power to the 'Ruler of the universe' and the 'Cornerstone' rather than explicitly naming the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is seen as systemic cruelty and 'impunity' that requires divine intervention.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative. The 'dread' of judgment is theologically harnessed to highlight the 'grace' of a world where evil is not ignored.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly low on Savoir-faire (how to practically 'keep awake').
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Briefly expand on what 'sober' looks like in a culture of consumption.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The preacher correctly identifies that 'cheap grace' stems from a trivialized opponent.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (The Cornerstone) strictly precedes and enables Ethics (The Weapons of Warfare).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It avoids the trap of moralism by making the 'dreadful judgment' the very source of the hearer's hope and agency.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Exhibit' structure; Greimas reveals that these exhibits serve to establish the 'Opponent' (Impunity) as a cosmic force only God can defeat.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the context of 1 Thessalonians; Greimas shows how the preacher uses the text to re-assign the hearer from 'Subject of their own safety' to 'Receiver of God's security'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'bride' in the opening anecdote is the model 'Receiver' who desires the 'Object' (Judgment) because she understands the 'Sender's' (God's) values.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (destines, hides, hides face, smites, is angry, involves self)
We (love, observe, ponder, repent, take up weapons)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Rutledge Rule' effectively, ensuring that even when humans are subjects, their action is a response to a prior divine action.
